I‚Äôve never met a force like Don and I doubt I ever will again. His shoes are ones that cannot be filled and I will miss him dearly. Rest easy, my friend.

It was my honor to serve alongside him not only in this great Chamber but also as Co-Chairs of the Cannabis Caucus. 
He taught me how to lean into an issue and create a path where no one had tread before.

A few years ago I traveled with my family to Alaska. My son and I went salmon fishing, and I asked our tour guide if he had caught any white salmon. He laughed and said there is no such thing. I told him my friend Don Young had me over for some at his cookout.

To put it simply, Don always remembered his roots and his roots will always remember Don.

His service to this body and the people of Alaska will remain unparalleled - though all of us in Washington should strive for it.

He stopped dead in his tracks and said, ‚ÄúYou know Don? Why didn‚Äôt you tell me you knew Don? He‚Äôs been on my boat! He‚Äôs a legend around here. Everyone knows Don.‚Äù

I realized then and there that we might have caught more fish if I dropped the Dean‚Äôs name before we went out.
For nearly five decades, Don Young represented the heart of Alaskan values. Every day his work was a direct translation of the will of the Alaskan voter.
